>I am glad to know it is possible to beat my extreme level with a
>legitimate team.  Like I said before, I will be working on creating
>scenarios to boost a team up to the point where a legitimate team
>composed of at least 2 members can beat it.  Right now, I am sending
>my slightly legitimate team through the tevfifty and see if they end
>up
>strong enough to beat my extreme level.

I've found that after defeating the two really tricky levels from the 
original set (Jakarta's Gates and the Manor Interior), tevfifty isn't really 
that tough. So set the difficulty to Slaughter to gain the most experience, 
bringing it down for the scenarios you just can't do at that level. The last 
couple are fairly nasty. Also, there is one inherent weakness in the 
levels--see if you can find it. I tried to even it out as much as possible, 
but there's still a major problem (which basically exists in all Gladiator 
levels). Anyhow, is anyone other than DPH going to download my levels?? Not 
to brag or anything, but they kick Tryx's ass and are probably as good as 
the originals.

DPH, let me give you some advice: resist the temptation to use too many 
character generators. Hitting the generator itself doesn't give you too much 
experience, and using more than a handful (especially bonepiles and 
high-level mage towers) can make the level unplayable for many character 
types. Most really good levels I've seen used a lot of ordinary humans, 
without too many blobs as major enemies. These have to be playable by 
non-magic users too...   I'm glad to hear you're going to use different 
maps. I'm sick to death of Scen0001, as it shows up EVERY time I start 
Scen.exe. Making maps is a lot of fun when you get the hang of it.

Shayd, are you making any levels? I thought you were going to, and the one 
scenario of yours I saw showed promise....

Tom, Tom, where are you? Just out of curiosity, how did David Chan get Tryx 
posted on the real Glad page? I'm sure there are some players that aren't on 
the mailing list, and they won't know about any new levels coming out...

       -Tevildo, Prince of Cats.
           (http://hotyellow98.com/tevildo/glad.html)
